Description: Body sherd of Rhodian Vroulia pottery cup; interior glazed black; above, lower part of incised palmette with added red blobs in alternate fronds; below, two incised bands; below, incised point of central star with blob of red; exterior glazed black; part of incised lotus flower with red blobs.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.569.t-v. If the sherd does belong to the cup, then it falls within Kinch's Group B 2.α
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GN.22) (phase 3)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 163)
